Isn't that your job? Back to parking, be prepared to pay $15 in advance then if you are back in 2 hours they will give you your money back. The policy makes no sense. Isn't that what the parking ticket is for, why do they need money? I think it's time for them to pick another parking company. Also the bathroom door doesn't lock so if you want bathroom privacy then I hope you don't have to go. The last upsetting thing that happened was the appetizer and the main course came out at the exact same time. Sad to say, but this will probably be my last time coming here.

Reviews.Author: John H.
Reviews.Content: This place is part of the reason I moved to Midtown.  Walking distance from my new place.  Close to the Fox for when I goto see live music.  The list goes on.So, I'm going to Ray Lamontagne this past Sunday night and needed somewhere to eat.  Those asses at Antico were not open, so my money went to Baraonda.  I've always heard it was good so it made for a logical second choice.First, we got there at about 5:45pm.  I swear it was perfect timing because within 15 minutes the place was packed.  We saddled up to the bar immediately ordering wine.  I have a weakness for wine.  It seriously is the best conversational beverage out there.  Baraonda's wine list, albeit a bit limited in depth, is pretty solid.Well the bartender (I believe his name was Andraio) was pretty good.  I think he was getting mad at me calling him Fulvio though.  Hey, Fulvio just sounds cooler.  So I kept on doing it.I decided to go into my "Dumb and Dumber" routine and ask what the "Zuppa del Giorno" was?  "Fulvio" responded in a thick accent, "it's zzzz zoup of zzzz day".  I said, "I'll have that".  It was pretty good to be honest.  I can't really remember it cause it was gone in about 30 seconds flat.Move onto ordering the pizzas.  I do like thin crust.  Love it actually as I used to manage a New York style pizzeria owned by two Italian guys from Brooklyn in my college days.  Oh how I miss thee Clemson.  I do truly appreciate the fact that Baraonda is kind of minimalist in their ingredient combinations.  It allows for you to truly taste 3-4 ingredients incorporated properly without being overwhelmed and dealing with a mess.  I went with the Bianca, adding Prosciutto, while my friend ordered some vegetarian nonsense and then proceeded to coat it with Red Pepper.  I thoroughly enjoyed the pie, figuring out pretty quickly that I could have easily eaten the whole thing if I was feeling particularly slovenly.  It's about that time that "Fulvio" asks if we want more wine?  My answer will 99% of the time to yes to such a question.  After that the night got a little hazy watching Brett Favre bitchslap Green Bay again and then listening to Ray Lamontagne be pretty funny between songs.  All in all, Baraonda is better than expected and I do like the fact that I can walk to it easily and sit at the bar.

Reviews.Author: Chris S.
Reviews.Content: This is definitly one of my favorite places to eat.  Great food (got to get the Fra Diavlo), great service.If they only had a better beer selection.

Reviews.Author: Adam K.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Baraonda a few times over the past couple of years, and every time we have gone there it's been a pleasant experience. Their pizzas are baked in a wood fire oven creating a pleasantly crunchy thin crust (If you love only deep dish then you may want to get a pasta dish instead.), and the toppings they use are both high quality and creative. To top it all off their coffee is rich, full flavored, and a nice way to end such a tasty meal.  The service here is extremely friendly, and in fact our waitress remembered us from the last time we were there 3 months ago.  The only warning I have for Baraonda is that you keep a close eye on whether or not there is something going on at the Fox Theater because people like to come here before and after shows. They also validate your parking ticket from the Bank of America lot, but it is about a half block away, so if you have someone with you who has mobility issues, you may want to drop them off at the door first and then park.

Reviews.Author: Bootsy L.
Reviews.Content: The food is as delicious as the hunks serving it up. Homemade pasta and brick oven pizza to rival Rome. I kid not. You want this.(5 stars if they had backed off on the salt.)

Reviews.Author: Joe M.
Reviews.Content: The food here has been very good almost all the time, with a few exceptions, like the chicken pieces that taste like pre-packaged chicken. The reason for the 2 stars is the HORRIBLE service! We waited 15 mins one time for them to take our order. Forget about getting bread, plates for the oil or having them take away your plates without asking repeatedly. Sorry but I won't be back!

Reviews.Author: Nikkie F.
Reviews.Content: A small group of friends went here for an evening birthday dinner, but nothing about it struck me as special. Average waitstaff, average atmosphere, slightly crowded and loud... but what did strike me as out of the norm was the food. Horrible! I ordered the chicken, and my husband ordered the fish. Both were dry, overcooked, unseasoned, and bland. And if that were not enough - to pay that much for food that bad?! I don't know if it was a fluke - or perhaps just a bad menu choice... but I won't be going back. It's a nice enough place, and convenient if you're visiting the Fox Theater just down the street - but don't look to be blown away.

Reviews.Author: Nique F.
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Fox, or Hotel Indigo if you're a business traveler. Food is hearty, and seems authentic enough. They've got a cozy low-lit dining room, bar area and private dining room. As for their private banquet/ event space, the staff was really skilled at keeping our large group of 30 happy. We especially enjoyed the "authentic" Italian waiters who didn't skimp on the charm, "would you like some more wine, my dear?"I had the luscious caesar salad, heavy on the anchovy flavor but fine with me. Then came the tender sea bass with sauteed spinach. No complaints - it was on the light side for an Italian meal, until the tiramisu came. Of course I had to clean my plate!Nice spot for a well-rounded Italian menu.

Reviews.Author: Brian K.
Reviews.Content: Disappointing. I've had better Italian fare from fast food joints....in airports....in Asia.Food: Baraonda offers a diverse array of predominately Northern Italian cuisine with an American Continental spin. They taut their pizza on the menu, but I've had far better and more authentic at Antico. Service: Unfortunately, the service is glacially slow. Moreover, on the two occasions I've been here it's seemed as if the servers weren't the least bit familiar with the menu. On one occasion they were out of several different wine options and the alternative recommendations the server was providing were not even close to the options originally ordered (e.g. originally ordered a sweet white and server recommended dry red).Atmosphere: The atmosphere is eclectic and the dress boarders on trendy casual, which I think is due to it's proximity to the Fox.Cost: Moderate. Appetizers are in the $7-$10 range and entrees in the $10 to $20 range.Other: The proximity of this place to the Fox Theater is ideal for a pre or post show dinner/lunch. However, they only take reservations for parties of 6 or more, so arrive early or you might end up eating on a paper plate at the pita joint down the street.

Reviews.Author: Dave L.
Reviews.Content: Great restaurant!Being so close to the Fox you should make sure that you are in the door by 6pm.Two friends and my wife for this venture.Service was excellent.Food was a mix. My wife and one friend found their a bit on the spicy side, so I traded my wife a great penne dish with shrimp for her crab ravioli. It was too spicy for her but I enjoyed it.Desert was outstanding! Terri sue as I love to call it was outstanding, this is a must.Only negative was the two groups of people beside/behind us. We were center restaurant where everything was four table settings, the place was packed with a wait outside the door. There were two tables of four that came in that turned into 16! Next thing our table was up against the door and one of our friends had to move three times. At first nonissue then it became annoying since one little man had to much to drink.One would think the manager would stop this from happening as they were there for a long night, annoying other diners, and most of all the waitstaff who saw their tip opportunity dwindling fast.Less that it was a fabulous time with great food and service!

Reviews.Author: Trevvor C.
Reviews.Content: For a Sunday afternoon wine-and-tapas type of visit, Baraonda nailed it pretty well for my wife and I and our hosting couple. The crowd was light, the weather was very pleasant, and we got a good seat on the patio (until the sun dropped a little lower and blinded half our party for a while). Our waiter was friendly, helpful and attentive without hovering overmuch.Two hiccups in the evening: our wine choice and one of the appetizers we ordered were unavailable. However, there were plenty of other good-looking appetizers to choose from, and our waiter was vigilant enough to have a wine recommendation ready, which we accepted and enjoyed. The calamari was the best I've had--it was thinly sliced, lightly fried, and excellently seasoned with a bit of bite on the end. The steamed mussels were good as well, but those are something I've had far less experience with and thus have little to compare them to.The restaurant has a rustic feel to it with rough-sawn tabletops inside and granite for the patio tables. Bathrooms are in the rear of the restaurant (men's on the right, women's on the left) after passing the bar.I'll definitely shoot to visit again when back in Atlanta.

Reviews.Author: Helena W.
Reviews.Content: Ive been here twice, the first time was with my Other and the second was a few nights ago with three of my girlfriends.  The atmosphere was great the drinks were wonderful the food was good.  I ordered the special which was chicken ravioli with a gorgonzola sauce.  It was very good but I got 5 raviolis.   It didnt come with a side or anything so needless to say I was hungry afterward.   I have had a pizza and a salad in the past and enjoyed both.  I will likely stick with those in the future.

Reviews.Author: Jessica B.
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed was the warmth of the place as well as a noticeable but not overwhelming smell of freshly cooked Italian food in the air upon entering.  This place seems to go for the epitome of fine dining while keeping it a laid back and friendly atmosphere!  The hosts here are very nice, very bright and warm invitation on in if you are looking for a great meal and prompt to seating.  And though the place can seem busy, I noticed that the staff was very well organized and collected about what all they were doing! The managers will even stop on your way out to wish you a good day. I noticed TWO as we left!  My husband and I were seated closer to the kitchen at a small table, which this part he didn't care for because of the size of the table but I personally found romantic (and glad to have him so close for such a perfect day for a date to the Fox!).  We were greeted by Alan, who was very prompt and had A FLAWLESS WAY of describing and recommending his favorite dishes on the menu (ask for this guy when you go! He is a fantastic server!).  He keeps great eye contact and is very open and friendly, making sure everyone is comfortable on his watch!  The food portion was average to perhaps small to some but as I'd hoped, filled with fresh ingredients and filling, nonetheless! These guys know what they are doing!  I had a seafood pasta and I cannot remember the name, but it was quite delicious!  All in all, though it's a bit on the pricey side, for a great and warm place to stay close with family (or with a date, he-he!), this is the place to go for that special ''Night out on the town''.     Bon apetite!

Reviews.Author: Roshanda P.
Reviews.Content: Just happened to try this place out for dinner before heading over to the fox. I didnt get chance to try of any of the pasta's which looked really tasty by the way... I had the chicken cesear salad... and a Magirita Pizza which are really basic items... but all really tasty, it was a not expensive at all I ate there for tax and tip for understand 25 bucks... My waiter was very helpful... and they had quick services....

Reviews.Author: Fiona S.
Reviews.Content: Stopped in for lunch before seeing The Nutcracker at the Fox. First thing to note - great decor. A little rustic, a little cafe-y, a little home kitchen-y, and the bar is just down right cool looking. Servers were very curtious and friendly. I had a spinach salad, which was quite yummy, and a pretty big portion. I need to go back and have a real meal here, but my first impression is that it's definitely worth trying again. For a downtown restaurant, the prices weren't out of control either. Not sure what parking would be like on a regular night, since we parked at the Fox's lot. Need to make a point of going back to try some more things.

Reviews.Author: Jessica O.
Reviews.Content: The pizza was good - nothing extra special, but pizza is usually pretty yummy.  Service was prompt.  It gets packed when there are events at the Fox.On our second visit, we were there for lunch, and it was quicker getting seated.  However, they don't have a menu with lower lunch pricing (because they're right beside The Fox, they don't have to), which I think is not a good business move at all, as we spent $50+ for two people at lunch, and the food was only so/so.  Don't get the tagliatelle with mushrooms - I didn't eat it, blech.  My husband liked his mixed vegetable ravioli better, but it was a special. The highlight was the mimosa for $3.50.

Reviews.Author: AngryYoungMan X.
Reviews.Content: I visited this corner tucked A-e-talian restaurant last weekend. On a cursory glance, it seems to have decent inside seating area but  patio seating is much nicer. My visit was for a late dinner so the place was pretty thinned out by then. Generally, I don't pay much attention to music in restaurants as food and drinks take precedence over everything... present company included. However, rocking Top of the Pop Chartbusters doesn't cut it in a dimly lit, Italian restaurant either.  If thats something that bothers you, skip rest of the review and look for another place. Wine selection was a little disappointing. The first bottle had to be sent back... it tasted refermented. Super Tuscan bottle of wine should not be tasting like Champagne! We started with an order of Salumi Affetati - a LARGE platter of cured meats. Salami and speck were especially delicious.  Entrees were tagliatelle with shitake mushroom and garganelli with sausage. Sauce was good on both orders but overall they were nothing extraordinary. Same thoughts for the dessert which was a large slice of Tiramisu. I am not an Italian food snob but I have developed my taste buds eating in some of the oldest Italian restaurants of Chicago so I am a bit spoiled. Baraonda fares better than your regular chain restaurants like Maggianos or similar, but it fell short in meeting expectations. I don't regret the first visit but it's not worth a second round.

Reviews.Author: Adam W.
Reviews.Content: Man, it was late when we got there and had a party of about 15 people. I did not expect what we got. STELLAR SERVICE! Half my party was drunk, and kind of getting stupid, and they still served us like we were cool. Hopefully the tip we left made up for the spilled beverages and occasional yelling from our party in the back. Everyone ordered mostly pizza and apps. All of which were good. I have already recommended this place to some friends and would again.

Reviews.Author: Mea A.
Reviews.Content: I had my first dinner at Baraonda last night and really enjoyed it. The patio is a little tight but it was nice to sit outside. We love to share meals so our waitress made some good serving suggestions. I thought the food was top-notch. We split the Bianca Pizza (mozzarella, olives, goat cheese, parmigiano) and the Penne Checca (with fresh roma tomato, mozzarella, garlic, basil, olive oil). For the most part, the staff was great. Our waitress was just a little delayed getting to our table so another waiter came over and took our salad order and told us about the specials. I didnt even think we were waiting that long so I wasnt bothered at all. ***DO NOT park at the Georgian Terrace! Before we left we checked the website and it definitely said that you could park there, so we did. The hostess was hesitant to stamp our ticket assuring us that we were wrong and that it wouldnt matter. We ended up paying $9 to exit the Georgian Terrace but when we got home and checked the baraonda website again it definitely said to park there. Today the website says to park at Bank of America and there is a sign outside of the restaurant that also says that.

Reviews.Author: Danie D.
Reviews.Content: Great food, had a whole Snapper, really too big for one person, but really tasty. The wines by the glass are a great bonus, quality offering at competitive prices. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Kelsey P.
Reviews.Content: I'll admit I've (somehow) never tried the pizza, but I really think this is the best pasta you can get in Midtown. I used to work a couple blocks away, and this was a favorite lunchtime destination for our office.Anyway, every pasta dish I've tried there has been excellent. I'm particularly partial to the Penne Salsiccia -- perfectly cooked al dente penne, a rich cream sauce, and some very flavorful sausage. I'd also recommend the spaghetti polpettine.A couple minor complaints I have are that it can get pretty noisy, and Friday lunches tend to require a wait. Other than that, two thumbs up.

Reviews.Author: Bryan R.
Reviews.Content: Eh. Eh is the best word. It was packed on a Saturday night, but I wasn't sure what all the fuss was about. The food was decent, but nothing MINDBLOWING.  I was disappointed by the lack of menu options... Half the menu is specialty pizzas, and I found the pasta choices lacking for an Italian joint. Also, no joke the bathroom was disgusting... Filthy, unflushed toilets, and what I hope was just water all over the floor.As for the food, I had veal ravioli, it was pretty good, and I was surprised that the portion filled me up. The calimari was also pretty tasty.  Overall, the food was just "not bad" but the atmosphere was a little high volume, and the menu a bit small. My suggestion is look up the menu online before you go.Overall: BUPDATE: the ravioli made me extremely ill.  Will not be returning.

Reviews.Author: Alice T.
Reviews.Content: Went on a business trip last week and a friend of my coworker took us here for dinner.  Wait was not too long and food was amazing. Starters: Carpaccio ~ raw beef tenderloin, arugula, capers,parmigiano, lemon oil dressing (really really good but the beef was really hard to pick up on the plate because it was super thinly slice)Cozze ~ mussels, garlic, red pepper, white wine (very tasty and sauce was good to dip with bread)Prosciutto di Parma ~ tomato sauce, Parma ham, mozzarella, arugula, parmigiano (topped with a lot of prosciutto and pizza was thin and tasty)For my entree I had the special porchetta.  It's basically a small pig with the skin.  The skin was really crispy and the meat was not dry.  All tasty.  Coworkers had the veal and the lamb chop and I had a chance to taste those too and it was good.

Reviews.Author: Ullrich M.
Reviews.Content: When my three friends entered on a Sunday at 5:10 before a Fox performance (I was parking the car), they were refused to be seated until my wife loudly talked about writing a bad Yelp review - presto, the sat. The nice waiter said "Absolutely" to having Campari, but it was out. The same happened to one of the white wines. My costoletto d'agnelo was so salty that I had to return it - they brought the replacement out in 12 minutes, but did not have the time to put on the sauce. The rest of the food was very nice. I would give the place another chance, but probably only on a Sunday when Publick and and Dogwood are closed.

Reviews.Author: Brett H.
Reviews.Content: Ok, I went here a few years ago and it wasn't so good.  Tried again tonight and it was shockingly good!Great portions, good prices, awesome location!  Keep it up guys!

Reviews.Author: Sara R.
Reviews.Content: I went here for lunch a few weeks ago after not having been in a long time. It was a Friday afternoon and the place was relatively empty so our party of two was seated right away. We ordered a special that day, the crab cake appetizer. The crab cakes were small, but for $5 were a relative steal. There wasn't any filler like you see in some crab cakes. We also got the Caesar salad, which was also great. The dressing is made in-house and you can tell - it has a lemon, garlic, and anchovy flavor that you just don't get from the premade stuff. Finally, the main attraction for me: the pizza. We weren't feeling any of the meat-heavy combinations, so we opted to create our own pizza with the toppings that they offer. I can't remember for sure, but I think we got eggplant, mushrooms, and zucchini on the pizza. It was absolutely delicious! The crust is thin and charred in a few spots, and it stayed crisp even with all of the water-intense vegetables, cheese, and tomato sauce toppings. Service was attentive but not so attentive that you feel like you're being watched. All in all, a wonderful choice for a light and inexpensive meal (it was less than $25 for the two of us).

Reviews.Author: Ryan V.
Reviews.Content: Went to Baraonda after a movie at the Fox last weekend.  Unfortunately, the experience was not as good as I had remembered from several prior visits.  The primary problem was the service -- slow, inattentive, and unapologetic.  The kitchen lost our order, and we were there over an hour and a half before we even saw our waiter to ask him about our food - to which he gave us a weird look, rather than words.  When he realized what had happened, he said "sorry" under his breath, offered nothing to compensate, and said our food would be out "soon."  Another 15 minutes later, we got our food, which was good (Ortomisto pizza, shrimp ravioli) but not good enough to endure the service experience.  No accommodation was made on the bill at all, with no comment from the waiter.  With service, I understand that things happen outside a waiter's control.  It was very busy when we got there, but by 9:45 or so (about 15 minutes after we arrived) the place cleared out considerably.  Nevertheless, our drinks weren't refilled until about 45 minutes into the meal, and by another waiter, despite sitting on a patio in 80 degree heat.When Baraonda opened, it was one of only a handful of places with traditional Italian pizzas, and its location next to the Fox gives it a great platform for success.  I hope their service returns to the levels its food and location deserve - otherwise, the development of the area and the growing gourmet pizza market will threaten what has been a Midtown gem.

Reviews.Author: Mike C.
Reviews.Content: I love Baraonda and don't eat here enough. Probably because it's very loud and I like to talk. The pizzas are just delicious. Make sure not to order too much on your pizza. Makes them floppy. Try my favorite the Fra Diavolo and add capers. Not much better can be found my friend. The margherita is pretty damn perfect as well.For pasta try the Penne Salsiccia; italian sausage, onions, and mushrooms in a delicious white sauce. Makes my mouth water just thinking about it. Yikes! As a matter of fact I've never been dissapointed by any pasta dish here.So stop by. And if you see a fat dude at the bar with a liter of S. Pellegrino and a smile on his face, that would be me.

Reviews.Author: Bob M.
Reviews.Content: This place has waiters for the single woman to die for!!!!! Dont miss out! Luca is your man.  If he waits your table you are in for a treat!!  I am still sweating from the hot sauce!!:)I have no idea why anyone would be interested in the TV?!

Reviews.Author: One P.
Reviews.Content: A port in a storm. Have eaten here 2x on two separate business trips.arriving late after a cross country flight. food is solid and price is good.

Reviews.Author: ERIC B.
Reviews.Content: Our friends from Athens took us to Baraonda for a quick dinner before the Ringo Starr concert at the Fox. We quickly realized, from all the Beatles T-shirts, that no show at the Fox theatre is complete without first grabbing a bite at Baraonda.We all had brick oven pizzas, but 4 different kinds. I chose the Capricciosa and couldn't have been more satisfied. The crust was thin and just the right combination of crispy and chewy. The ham was savory and plentiful. The mushrooms and olives were a perfect complement to the artichokes. I washed mine down with a glass (ok, two glasses) of the house Cabernet.We all agreed it was the best pizza we'd ever had and have been drooling at the memory ever since.

Reviews.Author: Cristine T.
Reviews.Content: The food is reliably good, and because of that, this place has become a regular part of my husband's and my rotation -- we eat there about once a week.But we've decided to stop because the service is so bad. For awhile, I wrote off the snooty waiters, but our last few experiences there have really pushed this place to the point of no return. Servers are overtly hostile. You say thank you and they stare at you blankly. You ask for something and they look offended. They plow through the restaurant, running into patrons without saying so much as, "excuse me." I have never seen the hostess smile. I have never, not once, received a refill on my drink. We usually wait 10 to 20 minutes to get the check because the servers disappear. Also, there's a weird issue with pepper here. Baraonda hordes pepper like it's a valued commodity. There is no pepper on the table, and the only way to get it is to have your server pepper your food. Which, of course, means hoping (praying?) the server comes to your table and doesn't give you a load of attitude. It's pretty clear that it's company policy to employ nasty, snooty servers because, in dozens of visits, we've yet to get a polite server. We won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Shaun K.
Reviews.Content: I've worked next door to Baraonda for years and it is pretty much the only restaurant  in the neighborhood that my boss will eat at, so we come here All. The. Time. for lunch. Like, sometimes I want to shoot myself because we're going to Baraonda AGAIN... but then again, when the boss is paying... but I digress.The pizzas are generally excellent. Pastas can be hit or miss. Proscuitto de parma panini is great.Finally made it over for dinner the other night, and it was as I expected. Pretty much the same as lunch, but a slightly expanded, more expensive menu.I feel like the quality of the server pool has been diluted a little bit since the owners opened Publik, though, as several folks moved over there and they have a lot of new people now.

Reviews.Author: Jason R.
Reviews.Content: Great Carpaccio, very talented staff! This place is a staple of Atlanta's Italian offerings, and now I know why. Everything from the decor to the wonderful wine list is stylish and authentic.  The bartender Justin was so charming!Definetely will be back.

Reviews.Author: Jerry N.
Reviews.Content: I had dinner here last night with a few colleagues and it was very pleasant - we found it on Yelp but didn't really read any reviews beforehand. The food was excellent and very moderately priced. For starters we had bruschetta and calamari - both were very fresh and flavorful. The caesar salad was excellent and I followed up with a Penne Checca which was excellent. I asked the waitress to have the chef spice it up a little and they did with no problem whatsoever. My colleagues had the Lasagna Casalinga and Garganelli Pugliese and gave great reviews for those dishes.This place has an extensive wine list of decently priced wines (mainly Italian as you would expect)...we enjoyed a Reserve Chianti and it paired nicely with the dishes we had. Great, friendly wait staff and I will return on my next visit to Atlanta Midtown!

Reviews.Author: Linda R.
Reviews.Content: Food was by and large good but couldn't make up for the awful service.

Reviews.Author: Michael G.
Reviews.Content: Really good. Went there on a quick business trip to Atlanta; front desk recommended this place and once we found it, which took a little longer than you'd expect, we were not disappointed. Food was great, typical Italian, but genuine, with the usual big portions that you get at an Italian place, but not too much. I got the lasagna and finished the entire thing, enjoying every bite.We got the bruschetta for an app., and again, really good, made with some Italian love. Most importantly, was no more expensive than an Olive Garden.

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: Good food, good service, and the prices are actually pretty reasonable.  Overall, I think this this place is worth going to if you want to find a place right in the middle of midtown to try.  Their wine list is quite extensive.

Reviews.Author: Katie S.
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Baraonda. I don't really remember too much about the first (too much wine I guess :)  I like the atmosphere here and the fact that it's a quick walk from my house. We sat at the pizza bar so it was cool to see them making the pizzas while we ate. I ordered the Mushroom Ravioli and my husband ordered the Chicken Picatta. I thought the Chicken Picatta was a better dish but overall both were pretty good.  I would recommend dining here for shows at the Fox or just a night out on the town.

Reviews.Author: Chris Z.
Reviews.Content: This place focuses on Neapolitan pizza.  Although there are many other traditional Italian options.  I had the daily special that included meat from a game hen.  The toppings were good.  The dough was freshly made but a little burnt on the bottom for me.  Service was awesome.

Reviews.Author: Foodie Buddha F.
Reviews.Content: Lois Griffin: So, Peter, where shall we go for your week off? Peter Griffin: Well, I... I was thinking we could all go to Purgatory like we did last year! [it switches to the Griffins floating in front of a plain white background] Lois Griffin: This isn't bad... it's not that good, but y'know... it's not that bad. Brian Griffin: It's so-so. Peter Griffin: Yeah... more or less...Ah yes, my neighborhood Italiano.  Though Baraonda is a very popular eatery, it is a spot I find distinctly "so-so."  The restaurant puts itself out there as an upscale casual Italian eatery, but I find the experience is often mediocre at best.  There are a number of decent things about it; unfortunately, I just can't get too excited about this place anymore.  Now that La Pietra Cucina is just up the street - I will forgo Baraonda anytime I need my Italian fix.With that, let's talk about some of the good things and the things that are neither promoters nor detractors.  The atmosphere and vibe are decent.  At lunch time, Baraonda does good business serving the local business folk looking for a nearby lunch spot.  At night, the crowd is made up of theatre goers and casual dinners.  It's definitely a popular spot anytime there is an event at the Fox (okay - maybe not if the event is Widespread - but you get the idea).  You may consider that good - or you may consider that bad - what it does mean is that it will be crowded.  The restaurant seems to like "organized chaos," as they leave you feeling like they have no idea who is waiting for what.  However, they always seem to figure it out.  Personally, this type of experience gives me an anxiety attack.  Service is usually nothing more than "existent" as it is neither particularly good nor particularly bad.Though the kitchen is hidden away in the back, the pizza oven is on full display.  Viewable pizza arenas are passé.  Unless the restaurant tosses the dough (and I'm pretty sure this one doesn't) - there isn't much to see.  Now when customers have a full view of the kitchen - then I get excited; unless of course we're talking about a pizza restaurant that doesn't toss the dough.   I'm not going to deduct points; but, the open pizza oven does not inspire me to eat here.  I find the menu is diverse but not overwhelming.  Though I have felt they should pair it down a bit - the offerings are streamlined, and your options fit neatly on one page.  They do a great business, so it's got something going for it.The cuisine here is a general failure in my opinion.  In all honesty, it alone does not necessarily warrant the 2-star score; but I've eaten here enough that it is a fair description.  They try way too hard.  I feel that the restaurant truly thinks of itself as a culinary treat... far from it.  I find the employees are taught to carry themselves with an aura that does not fit.  This extends to the food itself as the ingredients are basic.  You will not find any exotic dishes here; and that would be just fine - if they only knew it.  I wish the kitchen would just focus on making good simple food.  Instead, they make simple food that they think is exotic.This is the mass marketed type of Italian that is anything but authentic. People have spoken highly of their pizzas; but I don't think most in this city had the pleasure of eating a really tasty pie.  As a result, it is hard to differentiate between good pizza and rubber turf.As I've told people - I am not a big fan of the 5-star system that you are forced to use on Yelp.  I find that does not allow you to differentiate the nuances of a given experience.  I've eaten at Baraonda enough to know: Everything they do, they do "okay" Nothing is good and occasionally, it's bad.  I leave Baraonda feeling like I just spent 90-minutes in purgatory.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: My coworkers and I come here for lunch every so often and every time I have been satisfied with what I have gotten. This last time I had the Pollo Parmigiana. Yum. I thought it came with pasta because it was in the pasta section, but it was a huge chicken breast with a nice side of salad greens with a light dressing. It was quite good and nice portion for lunch. I've had the Pollo Panini and the pasta with meat sauce too. The pastas have huge portions. Try the Focaccia. Mmmmm. It can get pretty busy at lunch, but the service has been good even then.

Reviews.Author: Michael M.
Reviews.Content: Take it from this 100% Italian guy from New York..This is the best italian food in the city. Excellent Pizzas, pastas and wine selection. Great place to go out with a group....This is where me and the boys from the Italian club meet..that should say it all.

Reviews.Author: jacqueline b.
Reviews.Content: Love the four cheese thin crust pizza from a brick oven. And there is validating parking in a nearby garage. As someone who resents handing my car over to a valet, that alone takes this pizzaria above the rest of the downtown venues. I was intially introduced to Baraonda by an finicky Italian and he compares it favorably to places back home. Be prepared for a wait if you go before a show at the Fox is about to start.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey R.
Reviews.Content: I went  here on my first date with my (now) fiancé. The atmosphere was very nice and the service very good! I can't remember what exactly I got, but my fiancé always gets the lasagna...BEST I've ever had! I've decided now, the next time we go, I'm ordering the lasagna, so I don't have to steal bites from him ;-) Now, the part where they went above an beyond the call of duty. My fiancé set this up as our "night of engagement" dinner place. This was in December and since it's near the Fox, they were booked because of the Nutcracker. He called the week of to reserve a table and they told him that he wouldn't be able to get in...well, then he told the lady that he was planning on proposing to me. She replied, happily "Let me see what I can do." He gave her a little run down of where he was planning on proposing to me - it was outside the restaurant. She didn't have to say anything really, but she asked for details and he told her he wanted to do it under the canopy walkway across the street (which leads to the parking garage, where you can park if you dine here). She told them that place was fenced off and had been for a while bc it's under construction.  She even offered to take pictures of it and text it to him, which she did! He made a plan b, but we were still  able to have dinner there that night. The waiter almost spilled the beans, but I was completely clueless haha so I thought he was congratulating us on our 1 yr of dating, with that, we got two shots of lemon cello and a dessert on the house.

Reviews.Author: Jerry C.
Reviews.Content: I just have a few things to add.  Granted, we stopped in before a sold out show at the Fox (Mumford and Son- awesome), but Baraonda bills themselves as a place to go before or after a show at the Fox.  And  they weren't even slammed.  We were offered immediate seating on the patio then promptly ignored.  Eventually we wound up with warm beer and cold pizza- both resulting from an inattentive server not getting the product to the table.   The pizza came before the salad  which they took off the check.  Nobody seemed concerned as to whether we would have enjoyed a second beer (except us) until we had finished eating, with empty glasses. The pizza's had a nice char on the outer rim but was soggy in the middle by the time we got it. Possibly the crust was a bit undercooked.  They must rely on the fact that people who stop in before a show are reluctant to send a dish back due to time constraints.  We sat under a speaker which was blasting a techno loop that appeared to have no beginning nor end but lots of thump.  Annoying.On the positive side, the spicy salami slices on the  Fra Divolo are really good.   And the guy who fills the water glasses did a great job!

Reviews.Author: Emily H.
Reviews.Content: Great place for dinner, very intimate and dark. I enjoyed their pizza (many different kinds to choose from) and wine. It wasn't too busy when we got there around 7PM, but it definitely picked up later with only standing room available. I would recommend reservations if possible.

Reviews.Author: Rhonda C.
Reviews.Content: I love to swing in here after a show at the Fox.  I've had quite a few different pizzas here and I've enjoyed them all.  Good drinks, great wine list, and the atmosphere is cozy with dim lighting.  I do have to say that during one of our visits, we had to suffer through service that was sub-par, but overall I've had great experiences at Baraonda.

Reviews.Author: Naveen D.
Reviews.Content: The pizzas are good - Fritti is better. But, the lamb chops here were awesome!!

Reviews.Author: Lisa B.
Reviews.Content: Went here for dinner on Friday night before "Dream Girls" at the Fox. We had called ahead of time to see what time we would need to arrive to make it to an 8:00 show at the Fox. They told us that if we were there by 6:00 that we'd have plenty of time to get to the Fox. So that's what we did - when we arrived just be 6:00 the place was pretty much empty, by 6:30 the place had filled in nicely and our entire area was full.  Note: They do not take reservations unless your party is 6 or larger.First impression of Baraonda was it was a much larger place than it looks from the outside. There are three different areas - the main dining room, a smaller dining room and then the bar area. There is also a small patio off of the bar.  We sat in the main dining room which was dimly lit with wood tables and chairs. If you have a hard time seeing you may want to bring a pocket flash light or request to be seated elsewhere.Our server came over immediately and was attentive at first. As he had more tables seated his attention to us began to fade and he seemed more rushed with every interaction. Service wasn't terrible but it was a little slow. I started with the Casa salad which consisted of field greens, carrots, cucumbers and a vinaigrette dressing. My only complaints about the salad were 1. it only had one itsy bitsty teenie weenie cucumber and 2. there was barely any vinaigrette on it. It's not like I want a salad that is swimming in dressing but there really was like none on this salad. Oh well. For my entree I went with the penne checca pasta - penne pasta, tomato, garlic and olive oil - and I opted to add grilled chicken per our server's suggestion. The pasta was good, the tomatoes were full of flavor but I wish I had skipped the chicken. It was really dry and just seemed processed, not like fresh chicken breast hot off the grill. Next time I may try a pizza instead of pasta because they looked REALLY good. For desert I ordered the sorbet - two scoops of blood orange, one scoop of wild berry. The wild berry was great and the orange blood was good but too tart for my taste. I'm going to try the tiramisu if I ever go back...it looked amazing! Overall I enjoyed my meal at Baraonda. I highly recommend it if you are going to the Fox because it's really convenient - you only have to park once! The food was good and the service was average. I would definitely come back and try some of their other offerings.

Reviews.Author: Lori F.
Reviews.Content: Amazingly good pizzas, tasty house cabernet, and it's right next to The Fox.

Reviews.Author: Monika D.
Reviews.Content: This place picked the wrong person to mess up their order. After being seated and waiting 20 minutes with no service, I got my order to go. The WORST Chicken Piccata, yes they screwed up CHICKEN. Browned and beautiful, while raw fat and dry on the inside, bland potatoes, and I spent 20 dollars for that culinary equivalent of dog crap in a to-go box.

Reviews.Author: Jen K.
Reviews.Content: This is our go-to pre-Fox Theater dinner date place.  I truthfully think this place has the best pizza in Atlanta.  The only runner up in my opinion is Fritti, which can't beat Baraonda's perfect Peachtree location.  Baraonda also has great outdoor patio seating, which they close in and heat during cooler weather.    I have had about 10 different pizza combinations, and must say that each and every one of them has been excellent.  Thin, crispy, real Neapolitan style pizza cooked in wood burning ovens.  I've also tried a good selection of their appetizers (beef carpaccio, calamari, salad caprese, and bruschetta stand out in my mind) all of which met my expectations.  It is prettty rare that I have gone to a restaurant so frequently and not had at least one or two things I didn't like. Great wine list which offers a lot of affordable options.  One thing to note:  the service.  If you are coming on an evening when there is a show at the Fox, be prepared for mayhem!  It is usually packed to capacity, although the servers have always been very good about getting us served and checked out in time for the shows.   Give yourself plenty of time though and it won't be any stress at all.  Other evenings are much more chill, so keep that in mind if that concerns you.  Overall, we have always had great experiences whether we there during busier or slower services.

Reviews.Author: Blissful G.
Reviews.Content: I really think the quality at this place has slipped over the past couple of years. Their pizzas are just not the same...

Reviews.Author: M M.
Reviews.Content: one word, YUM! been wanting to come here for a while and now Im upset I took this long to frequent this wonderful Italian restaurant. Divine pizza's, great starters and a cozy atmosphere. The server was friendly , service quick and all the dishes (for the 5 of us) arrived on time. If you are a thin crust fan, this is the place you want to go to, highly recommended ! (oh and dont forget to try the deserts!!)

Reviews.Author: Sudhanshu K.
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand how this place received so many good ratings. When I looked up Italian on yelp this place recieved almost exclusively 4 or 5 star ratings. So I assumed this place was going to be great if not really good. But, I was extremely disappointed.First, we made reservations, but somehow, the hostess didn't note it, despite us calling her twice to make sure, and we ended up having to wait an additional 20 minutes. Then when she sat us down, she was not sincere at all, dropping the menus on the table and running off. Our waiter seemed like she was in a real rush, and that we were not important to her at all. Seriously, she was walking away from us while we were ordering.Now the food, to be honest first, I am not a big Italian food fan, but this place was as bland as they come. We first had the Calimari, which was average at best. Then for main course we split a Pizza and the Ravioli Special they had that day. The pizza had no taste, well cooked but lacked any substance. The Ravioli, was as bland of a ravioli as I have had, the Ravioli in a can has more taste. The crab meat was hard to taste, the only way I knew it had crab meat was by texture. But the crab taste was overpowered by the sauce they had. Maybe I went on a bad day or something, but this place did not live up anywhere close to the standard Yelp reviewers gave it.

Reviews.Author: Jamie M.
Reviews.Content: This place is the embodiment of midtown Atlanta.The food is top notch, the waitstaff is perfect, and the view of Peachtree Street is a nice backdrop. Make sure to try the taramisu, and you will thank me.

Reviews.Author: D L.
Reviews.Content: I remember the first time I had arugala was here. We were complaining about the salad dressing, that it had too much... something :) Haha. Pizza was good. The night I went it was super busy and the place was filled with all kinds of people. I am going again next week and hope to become a fan then.

Reviews.Author: Lizette C.
Reviews.Content: Went here before a concert last year at the Fox Theater. This place was right next to it so we just went to get a quick bite to eat. I wish we had more time because it was such a nice experience. We all had pizza (Margherita). Superb! Wait staff was freidnly and funny. Nice and quaint. Wonderful for a date or small gathering. Kind of pricey, but what do you expect for an Italian restaurant next to the Fox on Peachtree? But there are ways around that. Order an app. Having ordered pizza apps, we saved money (only cost $11-$13), and the meal was satisfying but still light and pleasurable. The perfect start to a perfect night. Go here!! It's worth the money!

Reviews.Author: Marie P.
Reviews.Content: I'm usually pretty reluctant to try a lot of the restaurants on Peachtree in Midtown because of the sheer volume of people. So, I was a little skeptical about eating here but after a friend's rave, I decided to go for it.I came here with an old friend for dinner. The space was packed because of a show going on at the Fox but there was only a 10 minute wait. While waiting outside (it was a perfect spring evening) we actually debated going to Enoteca because there was NO ONE there. But we stuck it out and waited for our table. We were seated outside on the small patio which was surprisingly loud. So much for a quite dinner. Our server took FOREVER to come to the table and when he finally did, the first thing out of his mouth was "Know what you want?". No "How are you" "Welcome" "Can I take your drink order" or anything polite and welcoming. It was jarring and it totally threw me off. After being completely stunned by that, we ordered the Caprese to start with before we decided on entrees. It's pretty difficult to mess up tomatoes, basil and mozzarella cheese and this one was enjoyable. Decent mozzarella and the roma tomatoes were perfect. We decided on a pizza and went with our server's suggestion of the Specialita - mozzarella, goat cheese, arugula and cherry tomatoes. Our server suggested adding chicken but we decided to skip it. And the pizza was excellent. The pizza dough was so yummy. It reminded me slightly of naan bread, which I'm always a fan of. Overall, the food was pretty good and I enjoyed it. But the service really turned me off. About 10 minutes after being seated, everyone left for the show at the Fox, so the restaurant was empty. Plus, it was a Thursday night. But that's besides the point. The restaurant was empty! Yet the service just sucked. There was no excuse for our server being so rude and absent. I still can't get over how he greeted (or didn't greet) our table! Ugh...

Reviews.Author: Broderick S.
Reviews.Content: It's just a couple of blocks down from me but I always seem to forget it's there. I went with a couple of friends and ate at the bar. The bartender was friendly and had a great time. I chose the caprese -- the pizza not the salad. They actually brought the salad, as I didn't specify that I wanted the pizza, but they gladly returned it and the pizza came out very shortly after. The Moretti beer on draft was cold and tasty. They closed at 10 on Sunday but we didn't leave til after 10:30 and were never rushed. Keep an eye out for the schedule at the Fox Theatre nearby as it will definitely impact availability, the pizza was excellent (the salad looked delicious too) and I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: T. Murray -.
Reviews.Content: What more can I say. Pizza, Italian food, and all things saucy. This one can't go wrong in my book because we are talking about my favorite type of food. I've had all sorts of things off the menu and have never been disappointed. I used to go here alot for lunch when I worked in the area. A cheese pizza with a little grilled chicken topping ordered here will never fail.

Reviews.Author: Karl H.
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place!  My $12 pizza was awesome -- I'm so happy I finally checked this place out.  I'll be going backa a LOT.

Reviews.Author: Tom W.
Reviews.Content: Great food and pizza.  Service is usually good.  Stay away during theater nights.  It gets too crowded.

Reviews.Author: Ray A.
Reviews.Content: Great spot for lunch.  The waiter was friendly and knowledgeable. Attentive, but not overbearing.  I had the Cesar salad, which was perfect. Just the right amount of dressing. I particularly like the enclosed patio.  It gives the sense of being outside without the 90 degree sun and traffic noise.  I'll be back regularly.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie S.
Reviews.Content: Food was good. Waiter was good. Hostess and restaurant owner/manager horrible. Hostess was extremely pretentious and treated my fiance like garbage (after my table spent almost $400.00). The manager was throwing his arms up at us as if he was attempting to pick a bar fight. Horrible customer relations. They did NOT make me feel welcomed in my neighborhood eatery. I most likely will not spend another penny here.

Reviews.Author: Vida D.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here a few times, none too recent. I've always had some sort of pasta, and it's always good. Nice ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Christopher P.
Reviews.Content: proximity to the Fox + crispy thin za + kind of pudding-like tiramisu = the only place I pre-game for the Fox.the pizza is always baked nicely.  the ms. and i ordered the specialita sp?, cherry tomatoes, goat cheese, and arugula.... yumservice was decent.  i'm not a big fan of dessert but I've never had a pudding consistency tiramisu....most events at the fox start around 8.  we got there at 630 and were finish in time to be early....

Reviews.Author: Margo R.
Reviews.Content: Completely divine. This is a great date place - impressive location, nice lighting and a menu that would please almost anyone. Delicious drinks and rich Italian dishes color the menu at this tiny restaurant. I loved the Carfuncella - a pink sauce with tomatoes and mozzarella cheese. I am picky about pasta, and I adored this dish! Definitely recommend this place to fans of Italian food and those in search of a romantic spot.

Reviews.Author: Diana S.
Reviews.Content: This is a cute little place with some nice little romantic nooks. We went on a Monday night and had one of the wines for $15. It was....ok. What can you say, it was a bottle for $15. The calamari and salad were both great. My tilapia was on the salty side, as was the side of sauteed spinach. However, my friends really loved their dishes. I'm giving this place the benefit of the doubt and hope that the over salting was a one time thing.

Reviews.Author: April T.
Reviews.Content: We took my inlaws here on their recent visit. We recently moved to the neighborhood and it was our first (and last) visit. The only saving grace is that the food was actually good. Our waiter was rude and especially condescending to my father in law...who is 85 years old. The restaurant was not busy at the time we went for dinner. The nicest employee we encountered was the busboy. I usually give a place a second even third chance but with the endless options available in this area I will gladly dine somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Author: Erich F.
Reviews.Content: Spinach and cheese pizza is awesome. The thin crusts are amazing on all their pizzas.

Reviews.Author: James H.
Reviews.Content: Met a large group (12) of friends specifically for what they promote as "Apertivo! Italy's happiest hours" which promotes complimentary appetizers. The person organizing it called ahead to check on the happy hour and told it was a go - but when we got there - because there was a show at the Fox - they said no free apps. There were cards at the bar promoting it - and was written in chalk on the front door. The bar tenders told us we could talk to the manager - which just ruins the mood of the gathering and shows poor customer service. Don't plan to be back.

Reviews.Author: PC S.
Reviews.Content: On the rarest of occasions I found myself actually ignoring my workaholic tendency and ventured out to have a social life for a few hours with random strangers I barely knew.  While it would be highly entertaining for me to review my companions for the evening, for those with weak stomachs or lacking the ability to appreciate accurate stereotypes, I will stick with reviewing Baraonda.  I pass this place daily when trekking past the eager homeless and the downtrodden derelict, but this was my first time venturing inside.  For an appetizer we split the calamari which was fantastic!  I mean, who doesn't love squidrings! I also liked how their calamari doesn't come with the little, sad looking fried baby squid that makes me feel like a total cruel and heartless barbarian as I devour its friends.  Weirdo #1 ordered a pizza which looked impressively like what you imagine pizza would look like if it wasn't delivered in a cardboard box and was made by someone truly Italian.   I ordered the Linguini Pescatore, which  is a pasta tossed with shrimp, clams, and crab in a tomato sauce, mostly because Weirdo #2 also ordered pizza and I felt like one of us had to be daring enough to order something other than some variation of my regular Friday night meal.  It was really, really good!  Too good in fact, as I gorged myself on the meal.  Granted this is due in part to my tendency to avoid all things carb laden now that I am in the post-lard, semi athletic phase of my life (see my reviews on my personal trainer for more on how I found muscles), but still I devoured it like it was my last meal on earth.  The flavor was distinctly authentic tasting and is right now causing my stomach to rumble as i post this review.  The Weird Ones then insisted I have something called tiramisu (sp?) for dessert, as apparently my redneck tendencies that I thought I kept buried deep down enough not to give me away, sold me out when I gave them a funny look when they asked if I had tried it before.  SIgh.I confess, I didn't know what it was...I have so much to learn to become cultured.  I still don't know what it is to be honest, but it was worth the harassment I'd receive if I ever admitted I now secretly love...whatever it is.  While normally I'm not much of a wine fan, there was a really good wine they forced upon me, the name of which escapes me.  I'm pretty sure it was something fruity and spicy.  It was great. In fact, it made me rethink my hesitancy to choosing wine over beer.   You should ask for that wine..specifically.  The fruity spicy wine drink that goes great with squidrings, pescatore, and tiramasu..tiramisu..tiram....that really good italian dessert.  I'm sure they will know which one I'm misremembering.  Food was awesome, service was prompt, atmosphere was appropriate and on target.  The next time I miraculously find myself actually going a date, I'm seriously gonna have to upgrade from Taco Bell to Baraonda.  My transformation continues.....waaaahaaaahaaa.

Reviews.Author: Luj W.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 4 and 6 year old kids for a special dinner before Peter pan the play. We were in a bit of a rush and let our server know right away. We put in a pizza and pasta order for the kids and in less than 3 minutes the pizza and pasta were on the table! I have never seen food come out that fast even in mcdonalds! The pizza was amazing and we all devoured it almost as quickly as it came out. We immediately ordered another one, this time we tried the margarita one. It was the cheese pizza with a few shreds of basil. Certainly NOT a true margarita! Pasta was a bit firm and undercooked, drenched in butter. Even worse, each "side order of plain penne w/ butter" was $10! Total rip off. My husband and I split a clam appetizer, casa salad and the fish of the day. Clams were delish. The broth was perfectly seasoned. The basket of bread was stale. Salad was a small mound of field greens with 2 slivers of cucumber. Only plus was the yummy dressing. Fish dish was on the small side with a tiny mound of spinach on the side. It was drenched in red sauce and should have been in a bowl. It needed a side of pasta and not worth the $24 price tag! Luckily, the 2nd pizza was all we really needed and we left most of the fish on the plate. I'm being generous with a 4 star rating, because we will definitely be back for pizza and salads and was great for the entire family. Here's the breakdown:Service: greatPrices: besides the pizzas overpriced and small portionsPizza: fabulousOther food: good, not greatAmbience: warm cozy upbeat and fun; great pre-theater meal

Reviews.Author: Joelle G.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food. Excellent service. And the wine list is superb! Would highly recommend :-)

Reviews.Author: Aimee B.
Reviews.Content: I love Baraonda and suggested it for dinner before we five saw Beauty & The Beast at The Fox. I ordered lasagne and the caesar salad - delicious!! Two others shared a pizza with prosciutto, sundried tomato and onion. They said it was a bit soggy and too salty. The other 2 shared a margherita pizza with mushrooms. The taste was great but it was very soggy. My daughter had grease? dripping off it. Not so pleasant. We did share the chocolate almond cake with vanilla gelato for dessert, another yummy item. The atmosphere is great and the service was very attentive.

Reviews.Author: Neil S.
Reviews.Content: First and last time here. Terrible service and food. The bar ran out of clean glasses so we waited almost an hour for cocktails. They eventually arrived - near the end of the meal. Lasagna was reminiscent of Chef Boyardee, and the mushroom fettuccine was inedible because of dirt/grit.  No effort was made to resolve the problems. And then there are the wonderful South Midtown criminal element hanging out by the front door and along Peachtree from the parking lot....

Reviews.Author: tracy r.
Reviews.Content: Lady at the table next to me accidentally spilled wine all over me.  The restaurant bought me dessert - how nice was that.  Overall great eats for a good price.

Reviews.Author: G. C.
Reviews.Content: Here's the heartbreaking thing about Baraonda:  you cannot enjoy their truly delicious Italian cuisine for the techno-beat pumping through the restaurant. As other reviewers have noted, this dimly-lit, perfect date/anniversary/business lunch or dinner locale is completely ruined by the head-thumping music. The couples sitting to either side of me tonight had to yell to talk. My friend and I heard their entire conversations (made easier, of course, because we could not have a conversation at all due to the music and subsequent yelling.)This restaurant is obviously prouder of its sound system than its food. Truly, it's sad.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy B.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best italian food & brick oven pizza in metro Atlanta.  I've been here for 11 years, tried virtually every recommended Italian eatery around & they still always come out on top ...

Reviews.Author: Lucy W.
Reviews.Content: Pre-theater choice for restaurant- I went here before going to a show at the Fox Theater about a block away.  I sat at the lively bar, and got a delicious and generous-sized pizza- ham, artichokes, mushrooms, fontina cheese.  The bartender recommended a great wine to go with it.  Overall, convenient, pretty tasty pizza.   It's crowded pre-theater so make a reservation if you are on a time schedule.

Reviews.Author: Carrie B.
Reviews.Content: Somehow it escaped me to review one of my "old-faithfuls". The hubby and I love popping into Baraonda for a pizza and salad or antipasto and rarely have any issues. When the weather is nice the little patio is cute and cosy and reminiscent of a little cafe in Key West or New Orleans. It's a great place to grab a quick bite or grab a bunch of friends and make a night of it. They generally take reservations for 6 or more, but when there's a show at the Fox they won't take them until after 8pm.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth N.
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, Good Food, Try the Calamari, it's tender and lightly breaded. Not a large beer selection but you can probably find something you like in a pinch. Like the Peroni, or Abita Jackamo.

Reviews.Author: Dave B.
Reviews.Content: Baraonda is a new delight. I've had the Penne Salsiccia 3X in the past week. Customer service is A+.

Reviews.Author: Christian B.
Reviews.Content: Good, but pricey. One of the few places to get a decent meal before a show at The Fox.

Reviews.Author: Dustin W.
Reviews.Content: I use to live in Midtown for a while and have been working downtown for years and never have had a desire to stop at Baraonda. I only wish I would've stopped here sooner. Probably the only Pizza I've eaten in Georgia that I haven't been disappointed with. I really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Heather I.
Reviews.Content: Another one of those places that I have driven by for probably 10+ years and have never been and for that, I am sorry. I have usually shied away from Italian restaurants due to my dairy allergy because usually the ONE thing on the menu that I can actually eat tastes like Chef Boyardee...but that SO wasn't the case at Baraonda! We ordered the calamari and Bruschetta as an app and the portion sizes were large enough to feed four people easily. My entree was the penne with vegetables and WOW I just want to rub this stuff all over my face it's so good. It even had eggplant in it, of which I am not a fan on Facebook, but they did something to this eggplant to MAKE ME LOVE IT! Our server, Han, was awesome; very attentive and made sure we had copious amounts of fresh ground pepper. The ambiance was sexy and fun and I definitely can't wait for another reason to come here again!

Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: I had the Costelette d'Agnello - sauté lamb loin chop, orange mint gremolata, mashed potatoes, green beans.  The lamb was nice and tender.  I found the green beans to be a bit well done.  I like a bit more of a snap to my green beans.  The potatoes were cooked well, but I found both the potatoes and the green beans to be too salty.

Reviews.Author: Cricket B.
Reviews.Content: Food was tastey but the service was lacking...in fact I felt our server was quite rude.  Enjoyed the gorgonzola salad and the ravioli of the day was very good but the overall experience was just not good, unfortunately.  Again, the server, just rude.

Reviews.Author: Paula S.
Reviews.Content: Went to Baraonda Saturday night to pick up a Caprese pizza and a Gorgonzola salad. The place is nice but the quality of the food is BAD! First of all the pizza is not big enough for 2 people. They threw a whole bag of Arugula on the pizza and it wasnt cooked at all. There was hardly any basil or mozzarella cheese and they didnt cut the pizza for us. The salad was just big chunks of lettuce and a little cheese and nuts. Not impressed by the food. Would not go back.

Reviews.Author: Starfish_Coffee M.
Reviews.Content: Good stuff...the pizza's are the best and love the decor.

Reviews.Author: Jen U.
Reviews.Content: Good pizza and ravioli! Worth the trip.

Reviews.Author: Barry B.
Reviews.Content: On a busy night service was attentive and prompt. Wine was a nice Montepulciano d'abruzzo. Entree was a wonderful papperadelle with lamb ragu. Flavorful with large juicy chunks of lamb. Very tasty meal- when back in Atlanta I'll visit again!

Reviews.Author: Chris T.
Reviews.Content: Outstanding. Maybe my expectations were low based on the other options I was seeing on Peachtree st., but this place was really excellent. Highly recommend. Lasagna was so good I was actually slowing down to savor.

Reviews.Author: Christina B.
Reviews.Content: We went here for a business lunch and it was great.  The space is very pleasant and charming, the waiter was attentative and gave frequent refills, and my prosciutto panini was delicious.  It might have been better on foccaccia rather than sourdough, but it was still great--especially the addictive homemade chips.

Reviews.Author: Ethel F.
Reviews.Content: BEST BLUE CHEESE OLIVE MARTINI'S IN THE USA!!!I stayed across the street at the Indigo last November for a few nights.  The first night I came here ate at the bar.  I watched the bartender playing with an olive and making a cocktail.  He told me it was a blue cheese olive martini.  It looked so fabulous, but I could not have one that night because I had to drive somewhere, so I came back the next night and had 2!  The food was fabulous!  First night I had the Minestrone Soup and a Gorgonzola Salad.  The soup was so delicious it just melted in my mouth.  The second night I brought my children with me and we had a Caesar salad, Penne Checca with Angel hair, Ravioli, and a Margherita pizza. For desert we had creme brulee and a tira misu.  We fought each other for the last bite! The service was amazing.  They customized the pasta dish for my picky eater son and he gobbled it up.  The bartender came over to check on my martini.  The ambiance is so romantic, even if you are alone you feel romanced.  The wine list is also superb!  I keep ordering those blue cheese martini's all over the US now, but very few restaurants come close to Baraonda.  I would fly back to Atlanta just to have another, as a matter of fact...I will be there next month with my boyfriend so I can enjoy the wine list as well!  I can't wait!

Reviews.Author: Dan R.
Reviews.Content: Ordered the antipasto and mussels appetizers which were very good. The entrees we ordered however, lasagna and veal masala were definitely not worth the price. Very very salty, not tasty at all.

Reviews.Author: Cousin D.
Reviews.Content: Been here a couple of times.  Loved it the first time and was not so impressed the second time.  Service was good.  Casual, which I like but just not a place you think of going when you are thinking of a good place to have dinner.  Sorry, don't love it.

Reviews.Author: Josh B.
Reviews.Content: I sat at the bar , ordered the Clam appetizer, they where ok. The bartender was friendly. I ordered the Pollo alla Picata - chicken breast,capers,lemon,white wine topped with poached cherry tomatoes,potatoes. I have had a similar dish several times & this was the worse. It was awful ! The pizza's coming by me looked good, but I would stay away from the plates .

Reviews.Author: Lee P.
Reviews.Content: Plan on going after the show starts at the Fox. Then tables can be had pretty quickly. The pizzas are excellent!

Reviews.Author: Stricky T.
Reviews.Content: This used to be our weekly Italian lunch cuisine (from work); its location was perfect and accessible. I recommend asking for the daily specials (a surprise awaits)........I have a favourite........... Linguini Pescatore - shrimp, clams, calamari, white wine, garlic, red chili, cherry tomatoes. The brick oven is a bonus and I must admit I was a little excited about that, fresh baked bread; good olive oil and nice parmesan reggiano (crushed black pepper)........tidy. Anyway, an Italian meal that is not too pricey this is a very nice place and you will enjoy the food.....................

Reviews.Author: Ginger W.
Reviews.Content: This is usually my choice before events at the Fox. I believe that they do the best job possible trying to seat tables when they are busy. They always have plenty of servers and food comes out fast. This place is good, but not great. It's maybe a touch overpriced. I have probably eaten here 20 times. I usually get a salad and split a pizza with my friend. I have never eaten here on a non-Fox event night. They do have a great patio area that stays warm even during winter months. If you are headed to the Fox, arrive about 90 minutes early and give Baraonda a try.

Reviews.Author: Ryan S.
Reviews.Content: We came here for lunch and were in a bit of a hurry. No worries. The staff was friendly and the food came quickly. The olive oil for the bread was a little thick, not what we were expecting. The vegetable pizza was fresh and quite good. For a "nice" restaurant, we were able to get in and out quickly, which was to our advantage since we were heading to Turner Field right after.

Reviews.Author: Andrew D.
Reviews.Content: Baraonda I think was fair, its decent italian food, the drinks are good and the price is reasonable. I wasn't a big fan of the pizza but the calamari was good

Reviews.Author: John N.
Reviews.Content: We ate here last night after not finding Enoteca Carbonari...  Which was a bummer since they didn't have carbonara in the menu (my wife's fave).  That was the end of our disappointment however since we loved everything else.  The chianti hit the spot.  The foccacia was really more of a flatbread, but delicious.  Cesar salad was fine and the vongole had a great kick.  She had a tasty feta pizza, but wasn't fond of the ...  My eggplant pasta was delicious.  Finished with a light tiramisu and we were quite satisfied!

Reviews.Author: Liz S.
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere and service. They asked if we needed faster service due to our show and gave us a table promptly. My chicken dish was amazing! To die for - pollo something under the secondi - really recommend it. Excellent excellent excellent. Our waiter was okay, forgot our bread and came by every so often, could've been better.

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: The host started the meal badly by seating us at a bad table when there were several good tables available. The food was overpriced for the quality and service.  I would avoid if you can find something else.

Reviews.Author: Raymond H.
Reviews.Content: Awesome food...poor service.

Reviews.Author: anya g.
Reviews.Content: Great Italian food for good prices and very nice waiters.

Reviews.Author: Nadia B.
Reviews.Content: Very bland food. Could be what we ordered--ham, potato and ricotta ravioli and the chicken picata. So disappointing and overpriced. Service was fine and the gorgonzola salad was okay, but nothing to go back for. Will not return.

Reviews.Author: Leann B.
Reviews.Content: Fusilli Zucca and Penne Checca were both outstanding. Bruschetta to start was very fresh and full flavored. You won't go wrong here.

Reviews.Author: Christina O.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant came highly recommended to me when I asked friends about a place to go that is near the Fox. I was a little let down (as were my two girlfriends), though, mostly due to the lack of courtesy shown by our waitress. She acted annoyed by our menu questions, did not refill our drinks, we were not given silverware, bread was late and not brought by the waitress, she did not ask how we wanted the check divided and when we put three cards in the book, she chose to simply split it three ways without knowing whose cards were whose. It was really unfortunate because the restaurant truly has a charming atmosphere and the food was wonderful. The servings are not large, so I was hungry an hour later. I would go again, but I certainly expect better service for a restaurant of this caliber.

Reviews.Author: Jamie P.
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere and wine selection. Loved the pizza!

Reviews.Author: M. C. C.
Reviews.Content: My favorite pizza in Atlanta.  The pasta is also excellent.  Great ambience and the staff is awesome.  My husband and I have been going there since they opened and it is always exceptional.  Great wine list, very good cocktails.  You won't be dissappointed in Baraonda!

Reviews.Author: K R.
Reviews.Content: The Chocolate Turtle caramel cake is a 5/5 the food however 3.5/5 was ok I got the ravioli of the day.  The server was very friendly and very receptive.  I would recommend trying this place if you want a simple date night but you must get the turtle caramel cake

Reviews.Author: Travis W.
Reviews.Content: This was an overall great restaurant! Everything we ate (lasagna, Gorgonzola salad, and margherita pizza) was prepared nicely and was delicious. I really liked the atmosphere of the place: fancy enough to have $200 bottles of wine, but casual enough to spend under $20 on a meal and go there in jeans. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone in Midtown, or in Atlanta for that matter. Definitely deserves the 5 stars!

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: This place is great...for lunch, for dinner, for wine and for dates (if you're secure enough).  The lasagna is huge, cheesy goodness (maybe a little too cheesy), and the personal-sized pizza's have a wafer-thin crust, with several interesting options - I tried the specialita recently and loved the heaps of arugala and goat cheese (I think it was goat cheese).  For lunch, lots of corporate types during the week (but they're OK, they can't help it), and for dinner the place is always full of loud people eating, drinking and enjoying themselves...an authentic Italian experience, or people on their way to the Fox.  Someone commented on the hunky waitstaff -- yeah, the hunky male waitstaff will hit on your girlfriend as though you're not there; no worries, the waitresses are all super cute too with a bit of european attitude.  The Italian dominated wine list is killer, and reasonable (which may explain the volume and happy vibe of the place at night).  For the thin-crust pizza, its 5-star -- the best you'll find in ATL, for the wine and lunch its 5 star for the value...not the best you'll ever get, but good value, especially for the location.

Reviews.Author: Amy G.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here at least 10 times because it's so convenient to my hotel when Im in town. And it's never good. Seriously, I always think that this time it'll be better, (cuz what's so hard about Italian food) and it simply never is. The wine list is ok, the Pinot grigio by the glass is rank. The sauces and pizzas are pretty flavorless. And the service is REALLY hit or miss.  And by all means don't bother going in when there's a show at the Fox, whatever food or drink they finally do get you will be subpar. The pastas are probably fine if you have small children with bland palates to feed.

Reviews.Author: Denise W.
Reviews.Content: I had the Italian sausage pasta dish. Like some of the other reviewers, I thought the food was bland. The other people in my party felt the same way. However, the ambiance was nice as well as our server.  Based on the reviews, I was expecting terrible service from the hostess and waiter; but both were very courteous.  I will probably visit this place again because of the proximity to the Fox Theatre and because I would like to try their pizza which looked scrumptious.  Overall, the food was just okay. I like Carrabba's a lot better.

Reviews.Author: Kelly H.
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with everyone...this pizza is AMAZING!!! the ingredients were soooo fresh and tasty. I ordered the fra diavolo which had tomato sauce, spicy salami, mozarella, and i paid 1.50 extra for them to add chicken. I called in my order since i would be eating my pizza alone :(. I went to pick it up and there was no parking.....little did I know that there is free validated parking in the bank of america bldg on 3rd street. so i drove around for 30min till i finally found one lil parking spot. I went in and the people weren't too friendly. I waited at the bar while the bartenders stared at me which pissed me off....then they finally decided to ask if they could help me and i got my pizza. I went home warmed it back up and hmmm hmmm hmmm......delicious....right amount of cheese...tasty spicy salami..the chicken i paid extra for was WELL WORTH IT. I will definitely be going back to experience eating at the restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Joe M.
Reviews.Content: Went on a theater night so of course it was packed and noisy. Food was 4 stars, maybe even higher, but service was pretty average.

Reviews.Author: E W.
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I cannot give Baraonda a great review. The service was horrible!  From the time we entered the door, to the hostess to the bar.  The staff was rude!  We even asked for the manager who had the same attitude.

Reviews.Author: TotallyZen J.
Reviews.Content: Warning! Check your bill.  I have been to Baraonda on numerous occasions before theater at the Fox.  Last week our waiter overcharged me for my glass of wine again.  This has happened before.  On another occasion he added an extra glass of wine to my bill. I'll continue to go because the food is pretty good and I like the atmosphere, but I'll stay on my guard and check the bill carefully.

Reviews.Author: John H.
Reviews.Content: The food was ok but the service was very bad.  The waiter treated us like an inconvenience or interruption in his day.  There is much better Italian food, with significantly better service, right up Peachtree at Cucina Asselina.

Reviews.Author: Michelle C.
Reviews.Content: I was underwelmed for the price paid. We went here because we were going to the Fox and I've always heard decent things about the place. While the atmosphere and decor were fabulous, the food wasn't up to par.  We ordered the calamari to start and it was definitely the frozen kind with no flavor and slightly too chewy.  We also got two of the pasta dishes and the portions were small!  Mine tasted fine, but wasn't anything I couldn't make at home and was not worth the $16 price tag.  We enjoyed a nice bottle of wine, but once again it had a screw cap and was overpriced at $32.  The shot of limoncello ($6) was worth the price and super delicious.  I doubt we will be back though.

Reviews.Author: Robert K.
Reviews.Content: Went with large party (26) with a table of ten 16 year olds. We got all our food and seperate checks within an hour. The food was excellent, I had the gorganzola salad and cariosa pizza. Both excellent quality. Others had the lazagna and bruschetta.
