While at first it appears like a small portion, it actually was enough and filled you up. The pizzas are big enough for two to share. Atmosphere was nice with enough light and a wine cellar decor. Very happy with the choice and was an easy walk from the Rennisance Hotel (10 min).

Reviews.Author: Greg P.
Reviews.Content: Atmosphere is ok.  My friend liked her pizza but the Place clearly needs a chef. The chicken piccata was the worst I've ever had and the lasagna was no winner either. Even the Martini was served warm. Add inattentive server just to top it off and it was pretty much the worst place I've experienced in quite a while.  There are way to many decent places in town to bother with this place again.   Beware.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany N.
Reviews.Content: my grandma loves this place. there's a guy that works there that she is completely in love with, haha. i believe i ordered the margarita pizza (i know there's an "H" somewhere) & it was good! the service was on point too.

Reviews.Author: Gina C.
Reviews.Content: Baraonda is fab place to eat before grabbing a show at the Fox. It does get crowded during show times, so plan accordingly. Also, they don't seat you until your whole party arrives. I've been here before and I didn't like it too much, but this time around I really enjoyed it. For starters we ordered the calamari. It was a little bland and the marinara was spicy! The batter didn't overpower the calamari so you can actually taste it. I also ordered the cesare salad and it was fresh and not soaked with dressing. Just tell them light on the dressing. I ordered my fave, the margherita pizza. I love oven baked pizza! My friends ordered the lasagna and fettucine funghi. They seem to enjoy their meal as well. For dessert we ordered tiramisu and raspberry cheesecake. I'm not a cheesecake fan, but it was so light that I couldn't stop eating it. The tiramisu was delish too. Dessert was the best part of the meal for me.

Reviews.Author: Meghan A.
Reviews.Content: I am in town on business and was really excited to try this restaurant which is adjacent to my hotel. I called and placed a take out order and was told I'd be called when it was ready. After 45 minutes had gone by I called to check on my order and was told it was ready and had been sitting out. When I asked why they didn't call me they said they wait at least an hour before calling.... this didn't make too much sense to me but I still asked the hostess who answered if my order would be hot or cold. She said she'd check  on my order and came back to say it was fine. I walked promptly over to the restaurant picked up my order came back to eat it at my hotel and it was practically inedible. I had to force myself to eat it because everywhere else had closed. I really don't think this is the best policy regarding take-out orders and feel I should have been told the food was cold or the restaurant should have warmed it up or made a new one for me.

Reviews.Author: K B.
Reviews.Content: Can be a little loud but a great date spot. The grouper is amazing, but I was not impressed by the lamb. Also our waitress was inattentive at best. The martinis were good as well.

Reviews.Author: Joelle G.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food. Excellent service. And the wine list is superb! Would highly recommend :-)

Reviews.Author: Amanda D.
Reviews.Content: Delicious, yet limited food menu with extensive wine list and yummy cocktails!  Reservations recommended.

Reviews.Author: Winnie H.
Reviews.Content: We ended up here by accident on a Saturday night.  We decided to leave after one drink (the place was dead) but the bartender coaxed us into staying to try one of his drinks, as he was "trying to develop a following." So, being the overly polite people we are, we stayed.  Not only were lavender infused sweet concoctions inflicted upon us, but when we tried to make a polite exit, we were each charged 10 dollars for these drinks. Needless to say, we will never, ever be back.  if you want to go sit in an empty bar, and drink crappy drinks that reek of lavender, then this is your place.  Otherwise, go elsewhere or just stay home.

Reviews.Author: MN L.
Reviews.Content: Great food, great atmosphere, and friendly people...always!!!

Reviews.Author: Jen L.
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was pretty great! The Calamari is AMAZING! It has a VERy slight kick to it because the put red pepper flakes on it - they are very lightly breaded so its not greasy or anything. I had the pasta meal - it was great fresh pasta. My only thing that kept me from giving them a 5 was that they were SOOO busy that it was harder to get service - but our server (when she had time) was amazing - super friendly!! Great time - will go again!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie G.
Reviews.Content: Just had their shrimp pizza and it was great.

Reviews.Author: David K.
Reviews.Content: Six of us stopped in after an evening at the fox for a night cap. No hostess so we seated ourselves. Sat for about 5 to 10 minutes while being ignored by the wait staff. Finally asked the bartender if we had to order at the bar. He said no someone would take our order. Waited 10 more minutes then left. Is the food good? Might be but I'll never come back to find out.

Reviews.Author: Nicole G.
Reviews.Content: UGGGGH! It is a beautiful place with great seating outside and very close to the Fox. We were going to a show at the Fox and tried it out. The bruschetta was ok...it wasn't bad, but I've had better at many places. I orderd the seafood pasta...the menu didn't say much other than it was in the pasta section and listed clams, other seafood, and wine. I would assume then that it was a wine sauce. But it came with a spicy red sauce....too strong to be able to taste any of the seafood and misleading because the menu didn't say anything about the sauce other than it mentioned wine. My mother got a smoked salmon salad that was arful in how it was displayed on the plate, but it wasn't that great. The service wasn't great either. In my opinion, this is another restaurant trying to be fancy in presentation and in atmosphere, but the food just isn't very good. From reading other reviews, it looks like the people that ordered pizza gave it a good review and the people that ordered anything else gave it a bad review. I'd rather go to a whole in the wall with great food or just sit home and eat a box of mac and cheese then spend the money to get food here again...just wasn't worth the time or the money. I'm not hard to please and have never taken the time to write a bad review....just sayin'....
